intro: Stawellia gymnocephala, commonly known as the naked-headed stawellia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant produces small, round, greenish-yellow fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
